articles.title: Valve confirms that it has stopped making the Index VR headset
articles.description: In case you missed it, Valve announced a load of new hardware this week, including a second stab at the Steam Machine , a Steam controller, and a long-rumored new VR headset called the Steam Frame . But in with the new often means out with the old, and perhaps inevitably, the company has confirmed t
articles.content: In case you missed it, Valve announced a load of new hardware this week, including a second stab at the Steam Machine , a Steam controller, and a long-rumored new VR headset called the Steam Frame . But in with the new often means out with the old, and perhaps inevitably, the company has confirmed that its previous headset, the Valve Index, is no more. Valve‚Äôs Lawrence Yang told The Verge that it‚Äôs "no longer manufacturing" the Index, which we called "the best desktop VR yet" when it launched in
articles.author: Matt Tate

For teams shipping agentic applications‚Äîvoice agents, copilots, and RAG systems‚Äîquality is not a single metric or a one-time test. It is a lifecycle discipline that spans experimentation, simulation, evaluation, and in‚Äëproduction observabi
articles.content: High-quality responses are the foundation of trustworthy AI. For teams shipping agentic applications‚Äîvoice agents, copilots, and RAG systems‚Äîquality is not a single metric or a one-time test. It is a lifecycle discipline that spans experimentation, simulation, evaluation, and in‚Äëproduction observability. This guide brings a practical, engineering-first approach to ensuring response quality, backed by research, and shows how Maxim AI‚Äôs full‚Äëstack platform and Bifrost AI gateway help teams build r

articles.content: Google DeepMind‚Äôs new AI agent learned how to play a bunch of video games ‚Äî including No Man‚Äôs Sky , Valheim , and Goat Simulator 3 ‚Äî to become a viable ‚Äúinteractive gaming companion.‚Äù The new agent tool, SIMA 2, builds on its earlier iteration, SIMA (Scalable Instructable Multiworld Agent), which DeepMind released in March 2024. articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. AI is changing how we quantify pain Researchers around the world are racing to turn pain‚Äîmedicine‚Äôs most subjective vital sign‚Äîinto something a camera or sensor can score as reliably as blood pressure. That‚Äôs what we call prompting . Even when asking the same thing, tiny changes in how you phrase it can shift the tone, depth, or even t
articles.content: In today‚Äôs world of AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Microsoft Copilot, one thing stands out: üëâ The way you ask a question completely changes the answer you get. That‚Äôs what we call prompting . Even when asking the same thing, tiny changes in how you phrase it can shift the tone, depth, or even the accuracy of the answer. What Is Prompting? Prompting is how you communicate with an AI tool ‚Äî basically, the instructions you give. If you think of AI as a new teammate, your prompt is your task de

articles.title: How Copilot helps build the GitHub platform
articles.description: A breakdown of how Copilot coding agent has contributed to a better, more powerful GitHub. The post How Copilot helps build the GitHub platform appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: As engineers at GitHub, “dogfooding” is core to our culture. We build GitHub on GitHub, using the same tools we ship to developers. But as GitHub Copilot has evolved from an autocomplete suggestion to a sophisticated AI assistant, our own use of it has evolved, too. It’s no longer just a tool in our editors. We’ve integrated Copilot directly into our development lifecycle. Inside our core repository, the one we use to build github.com, @Copilot isn’t just suggesting
